sentences.en: Don't be afraid to consider apparently extravagant ideas.
sentences.cn: 要勇于考虑一些貌似离谱的想法。

sentences.en: Don't be so extravagant, spend your money more carefully.
sentences.cn: 不要如此挥霍, 花钱要仔细点.

sentences.en: Don’t be too extravagant with the wine.
He is too extravagant with his clothes.
He was extravagant in his admiration of Hellas.
Her Aunt Sallie gave her an uncharacteristically extravagant gift.
sentences.cn: 萨莉姨妈送给她一件贵得离谱的礼物。

sentences.en: I can have a brainstorm and be very extravagant.
sentences.cn: 我有时会头脑发热，挥霍无度。

sentences.en: Oppose extravagant eating and drinking and pay attention to thrift and economy.
sentences.cn: 反对大吃大喝,注意节约.

sentences.en: The coronation was an occasion for extravagant myth and sentiment.
sentences.cn: 加冕典礼是极尽奢华和怀旧的仪式。

sentences.en: They may make extravagant shows of generosity.
sentences.cn: 他们可能会表现得过于慷慨。

sentences.en: They tried to please him with fulsome compliments and extravagant gifts.
sentences.cn: 他们想用溢美之词和奢华的礼品来取悦他.

sentences.en: We are not extravagant; restaurant meals are a luxury and designer clothes are out.
sentences.cn: 我们并不铺张浪费：下馆子是一种奢侈，也不会考虑买名牌衣服。

sentences.en: Who is footing the bill for her extravagant holiday?
sentences.cn: 谁会为她奢侈的假日买单？

sentences.en: Would it be too extravagant to buy both?
sentences.cn: 把两个都买下会不会太奢侈了？

sentences.en: You must curb your extravagant tastes.
sentences.cn: 你必须控制自己铺张奢侈的嗜好。

words.tran_cn: 奢侈，浪费；过度；放肆的言行

trans.tran_en: spending or costing a lot of money, especially more than is necessary or more than you can afford
